One day, they decided to race on a bumpy path. They pedaled as hard as they could and tried to avoid the rocks and holes. Tom was ahead of Lily, but he did not see a big stick on the ground. He hit the stick with his front wheel and lost his balance. His bike flipped over and he fell off. His wheel came off too and rolled away.
"Ouch!" Tom cried. He scraped his knee and elbow and felt a bump on his head. He looked at his bike and saw that it was broken. He felt sad and angry.

He was so scared but he walked closer and closer until he saw a ladybug. "Hello," she whispered. "I am the queen of this hive and I need your help. Would you please collect all of the colorful flowers around the hive?"

we care for this leaf. It is our home!"
The bird was very mad. She tried to take the leaf away from the bugs. The bugs tried to stop her, but she was too big and strong. The bird took the huge leaf and flew away.
The group of bugs was very sad. They lost their huge leaf that they cared for. They had no place to play and live. The bugs had to find a new home, but they missed their old leaf very much.

"Hi, Fred! I'm Lily. I like to wash my hands in the stream," Lily replied.

Tom asked, "Why are you anxious, frog?" The frog said, "I am scared. I want to go to the other side of the creek, but I can't jump that far." Tom wanted to help the frog.
Tom found a big stick. He put the stick in the water and split it in half. Now, there were two smaller sticks. Tom put the sticks on the rocks, so the frog could jump across. The frog was happy and said, "Thank you, Tom!" Tom felt good for helping the frog.
The moral of the story is to always help others when they are in need.

One day, Tom and Sue were playing in the park. They saw a big empty box. They wanted to play with the box, but they did not want to play alone. They thought it would be more fun to unite with their friends.
Tom and Sue asked their friends, Jim and Ann, to come play with them. Together, they all pushed the big empty box to a nice spot under a tree.

a time, in a small village, there was a creek. A little girl named Lily liked to gather rocks near the creek. One day, Lily saw a big, tough frog sitting by the water. The frog looked sad.
Lily asked the frog, "Why are you sad?" The frog said, "I am too tough, and no one wants to be my friend." Lily felt bad for the frog and wanted to help.

Tommy and his mother were walking in the forest. Tommy noticed the pale, symmetrical pattern of the trees. He was fascinated by the beauty of nature.
"Mummy, look at this!" Tommy said. "It's so pretty!"
Mummy smiled. "Yes, it is!"
Suddenly, a huge gust of wind blew through the forest and it began to pour with rain.
"Oh no!" Mummy said. "We need to find shelter before it gets worse!"
Tommy nodded and followed Mummy. They ran, but the rain kept coming. Finally, they spotted a big tree.

Lila and Ben were playing in the garden. They liked to dig holes and look for worms and stones. Lila found a shiny stone that was round and smooth. She showed it to Ben and said, "Look, I found a treasure!"
Ben looked at the stone and said, "That's not a treasure, that's a marble. I have many marbles at home. They are not special."
Lila felt sad. She liked her stone and thought it was special. She said, "But it's so pretty and shiny. And it

in a kind and gentle voice said, "Anna, I understand how it feels to see something so beautiful, but this flower belongs in nature, and it needs to go back. You can come with me to pick a different flower for you to keep forever." 
Anna smiled, stopped crying and agreed to go with the police officer to find a perfect flower for her. 
The end.

Benny tried to make Lizzy feel happy by bringing her yummy bugs to eat. Lizzy liked the bugs and started to feel less shy. She said "thank you" to Benny and they became good friends. The other animals saw how kind Benny was to Lizzy, and they all wanted to be friends too.
The moral of the story is that being kind can help others feel less shy and make many friends.

One day, a little boy named Tim came to see the machine. He wanted to help the tired machine. He tried to fit the big blocks into the small holes, but they would not go in. Tim thought and thought. Then, he had an idea!
Tim tried to fit the big blocks into big holes. And guess what? They fit! The machine was not tired anymore. It could work better now. Tim and the machine were happy. They had found a new way to fit the blocks and the machine could rest.

Once upon a time, there was a little boy named Tim. Tim liked to play outside in the dirt. He liked to dig and make big holes in the earth. One day, Tim found a small, round rock. He did not know it was a magic rock. Tim was ignorant about the rock's power.

much worse than they expected. The island was covered in rubbish and weeds. But Sam and Martha weren't giving up!
They started to work hard, picking up the rubbish and clearing the weeds. It took a few days hard work, but slowly and surely the island started to look better.
Finally, after a few weeks of hard work, the island was restored to its former glory. Sam and Martha were both very tired, but they were also very proud of their work.
